trans-unit.source: Edit sprites
trans-unit.target: Edit sprites

trans-unit.source: Beginner Designer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Designer

trans-unit.source: After you import a sprite sheet, you can use the dedicated Sprite Editor to select sprites within the sprite sheet.
trans-unit.target: After you import a sprite sheet, you can use the dedicated Sprite Editor to select sprites within the sprite sheet.

trans-unit.source: You can also edit sprite properties in the Property Grid like any other asset.
trans-unit.target: You can also edit sprite properties in the Property Grid like any other asset.

trans-unit.source: Open the Sprite Editor
trans-unit.target: Open the Sprite Editor

trans-unit.source: To open the Sprite Editor, in the Asset View, double-click the sprite sheet asset.
trans-unit.target: To open the Sprite Editor, in the Asset View, double-click the sprite sheet asset.

trans-unit.source: The sprite sheet opens in the Sprite Editor.
trans-unit.target: The sprite sheet opens in the Sprite Editor.

trans-unit.source: Sprite Editor
trans-unit.target: Sprite Editor

trans-unit.source: Set sprite sheet type
trans-unit.target: Set sprite sheet type

trans-unit.source: You can set whether the sprite sheet contains gameplay sprites (Sprite2D) or UI sprites (UI). This has no effect on how the sprite is rendered at runtime, but lets you set slightly different properties, described under Sprite properties below. You can change the sprite sheet type any time.
trans-unit.target: You can set whether the sprite sheet contains gameplay sprites (Sprite2D) or UI sprites (UI). This has no effect on how the sprite is rendered at runtime, but lets you set slightly different properties, described under Sprite properties below. You can change the sprite sheet type any time.

trans-unit.source: Choose Sprite 2D or UI
trans-unit.target: Choose Sprite 2D or UI

trans-unit.source: Add a sprite
trans-unit.target: Add a sprite

trans-unit.source: Click the Add empty sprite button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Add empty sprite button.

trans-unit.source: Add sprite
trans-unit.target: Add sprite

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a empty sprite to the list.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a empty sprite to the list.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid on the right, in the Source field, specify the sprite sheet that contains the sprite.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid on the right, in the Source field, specify the sprite sheet that contains the sprite.

trans-unit.source: !Tip If you want to create a new sprite from the same sprite sheet as other sprites in the list, it's often faster to duplicate an existing sprite. To duplicate a sprite, select it and click Duplicate selected sprites or press Ctrl + D.
trans-unit.target: !Tip If you want to create a new sprite from the same sprite sheet as other sprites in the list, it's often faster to duplicate an existing sprite. To duplicate a sprite, select it and click Duplicate selected sprites or press Ctrl + D.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate selected sprites
trans-unit.target: Duplicate selected sprites

trans-unit.source: Sprite list
trans-unit.target: Sprite list

trans-unit.source: The Sprite Editor lists the sprites in your project on the left. Each sprite has an index number; the first has the index 0, second has index 1, and so on. You can use these indexes in your scripts (see Use sprites).
trans-unit.target: The Sprite Editor lists the sprites in your project on the left. Each sprite has an index number; the first has the index 0, second has index 1, and so on. You can use these indexes in your scripts (see Use sprites).

trans-unit.source: Sprite list
trans-unit.target: Sprite list

trans-unit.source: To change the order (and index number) of sprites, use the Move selected sprite up/down (Move selected sprite up/down) buttons. For example, if you move 1 Sprite down, it becomes 2 Sprite.
trans-unit.target: To change the order (and index number) of sprites, use the Move selected sprite up/down (Move selected sprite up/down) buttons. For example, if you move 1 Sprite down, it becomes 2 Sprite.

trans-unit.source: To rename a sprite in the list, double-click it and type a new name.
trans-unit.target: To rename a sprite in the list, double-click it and type a new name.

trans-unit.source: Set the texture region
trans-unit.target: Set the texture region

trans-unit.source: You create sprites by defining rectangular texture regions in the sprite sheet.
trans-unit.target: You create sprites by defining rectangular texture regions in the sprite sheet.

trans-unit.source: Select a sprite region
trans-unit.target: Select a sprite region

trans-unit.source: There are three ways to do this: by using the Magic Wand tool, by setting the edges of the region manually, or by specifying the pixel coordinates in the sprite properties.
trans-unit.target: There are three ways to do this: by using the Magic Wand tool, by setting the edges of the region manually, or by specifying the pixel coordinates in the sprite properties.

trans-unit.source: Use the Magic Wand
trans-unit.target: Use the Magic Wand

trans-unit.source: The Magic Wand selects the texture region around a sprite automatically. This is usually the fastest way to select sprites.
trans-unit.target: The Magic Wand selects the texture region around a sprite automatically. This is usually the fastest way to select sprites.

trans-unit.source: Magic wand
trans-unit.target: Magic wand

trans-unit.source: To select or deselect the Magic Wand, click the icon in the Sprite Editor toolbar, or press the M key.
trans-unit.target: To select or deselect the Magic Wand, click the icon in the Sprite Editor toolbar, or press the M key.

trans-unit.source: Select Magic Wand
trans-unit.target: Select Magic Wand

trans-unit.source: To choose how the Magic Wand identifies texture regions, use the drop-down list in the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: To choose how the Magic Wand identifies texture regions, use the drop-down list in the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Select transparency or color key
trans-unit.target: Select transparency or color key

trans-unit.source: Transparency: The Magic Wand treats the edges of the non-transparent regions as the edges of the texture region. For example, if the sprite is surrounded by transparent space, it sets the texture region at the edge of the transparent space.
trans-unit.target: Transparency: The Magic Wand treats the edges of the non-transparent regions as the edges of the texture region. For example, if the sprite is surrounded by transparent space, it sets the texture region at the edge of the transparent space.

trans-unit.source: Color key: The Magic Wand identifies texture regions using the color set under Color key in the Sprite Editor. For example, if the sprite is surrounded by absolute black (#FF000000), and you set absolute black as the color key, the Magic Wand sets the texture region at the edge of the absolute black space.
trans-unit.target: Color key: The Magic Wand identifies texture regions using the color set under Color key in the Sprite Editor. For example, if the sprite is surrounded by absolute black (#FF000000), and you set absolute black as the color key, the Magic Wand sets the texture region at the edge of the absolute black space.

trans-unit.source: Set texture region manually
trans-unit.target: Set texture region manually

trans-unit.source: You can drag the edges of the texture region and reposition the region manually.
trans-unit.target: You can drag the edges of the texture region and reposition the region manually.

trans-unit.source: Set the texture region in the Property Grid
trans-unit.target: Set the texture region in the Property Grid

trans-unit.source: You can define the pixel coordinates of the texture region in Property Grid under Texture Region. X is the left edge, Y is the top, Z is the right, and W is the bottom.
trans-unit.target: You can define the pixel coordinates of the texture region in Property Grid under Texture Region. X is the left edge, Y is the top, Z is the right, and W is the bottom.

trans-unit.source: Set texture region in Property Grid
trans-unit.target: Set texture region in Property Grid

trans-unit.source: Use entire sprite sheet for the sprite
trans-unit.target: Use entire sprite sheet for the sprite

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the entire sprite sheet image for the sprite, you can do this quickly by clicking Use whole image for this sprite in the toolbar. This is useful when you have only one sprite in a sprite sheet.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the entire sprite sheet image for the sprite, you can do this quickly by clicking Use whole image for this sprite in the toolbar. This is useful when you have only one sprite in a sprite sheet.

trans-unit.source: Use entire sprite sheet
trans-unit.target: Use entire sprite sheet

trans-unit.source: Set transparency
trans-unit.target: Set transparency

trans-unit.source: By default, Stride treats transparent areas of the sprite sheet as transparent at runtime. Alternatively, you can set a key color as transparent. To do this, select Use color key and define a color. For example, if you set absolute black (#FF000000), areas of absolute black are transparent at runtime.
trans-unit.target: By default, Stride treats transparent areas of the sprite sheet as transparent at runtime. Alternatively, you can set a key color as transparent. To do this, select Use color key and define a color. For example, if you set absolute black (#FF000000), areas of absolute black are transparent at runtime.

trans-unit.source: Select color key
trans-unit.target: Select color key

trans-unit.source: You can also use the color picker tool to select a color from the sprite sheet.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the color picker tool to select a color from the sprite sheet.

trans-unit.source: Color picker
trans-unit.target: Color picker

trans-unit.source: Sprite properties
trans-unit.target: Sprite properties

trans-unit.source: You can set the properties of individual sprites in the Property Grid.
trans-unit.target: You can set the properties of individual sprites in the Property Grid.

trans-unit.source: Adjust frame properties
trans-unit.target: Adjust frame properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: The path to the sprite sheet
trans-unit.target: The path to the sprite sheet

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The name of this sprite. You can also edit this by double-clicking a sprite in the sprite list in the Sprite Editor
trans-unit.target: The name of this sprite. You can also edit this by double-clicking a sprite in the sprite list in the Sprite Editor

trans-unit.source: Texture region
trans-unit.target: Texture region

trans-unit.source: The region of the sprite sheet used for this sprite
trans-unit.target: The region of the sprite sheet used for this sprite

trans-unit.source: Pixels per unit
trans-unit.target: Pixels per unit

trans-unit.source: The number of pixels representing a unit in the scene. The higher this number, the smaller the sprite is rendered in the scene
trans-unit.target: The number of pixels representing a unit in the scene. The higher this number, the smaller the sprite is rendered in the scene

trans-unit.source: Orientation
trans-unit.target: Orientation

trans-unit.source: If you select Rotated90, Stride rotates the sprite 90 degrees at runtime
trans-unit.target: If you select Rotated90, Stride rotates the sprite 90 degrees at runtime

trans-unit.source: Center
trans-unit.target: Center

trans-unit.source: The position of the center of the sprite, in pixels. By default, the center is 0, 0. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet type is set to Sprite2D in the Sprite Editor.
trans-unit.target: The position of the center of the sprite, in pixels. By default, the center is 0, 0. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet type is set to Sprite2D in the Sprite Editor.

trans-unit.source: Center from middle
trans-unit.target: Center from middle

trans-unit.source: Have the value in the Center property represent the offset of the sprite center from the middle of the sprite. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet type is set to Sprite2D in the Sprite Editor.
trans-unit.target: Have the value in the Center property represent the offset of the sprite center from the middle of the sprite. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet type is set to Sprite2D in the Sprite Editor.

trans-unit.source: Borders
trans-unit.target: Borders

trans-unit.source: The size in pixels of the sprite borders (areas that don't deform when stretched). X is the left border, Y is the top, Z is the right, and W is the bottom. For more information, see Set sprite borders. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet is set to UI on the left.
trans-unit.target: The size in pixels of the sprite borders (areas that don't deform when stretched). X is the left border, Y is the top, Z is the right, and W is the bottom. For more information, see Set sprite borders. Note: this property is only available if the sprite sheet is set to UI on the left.

trans-unit.source: Sprite sheet properties
trans-unit.target: Sprite sheet properties

trans-unit.source: You can also set the properties for the entire sprite sheet asset. To access the properties:
trans-unit.target: You can also set the properties for the entire sprite sheet asset. To access the properties:

trans-unit.source: select the sprite sheet asset in the Asset View and set the properties in the Property Grid, or
trans-unit.target: select the sprite sheet asset in the Asset View and set the properties in the Property Grid, or

trans-unit.source: in the Sprite Editor, click Sprite sheet properties.
trans-unit.target: in the Sprite Editor, click Sprite sheet properties.

trans-unit.source: Sprite sheet properties button
trans-unit.target: Sprite sheet properties button

trans-unit.source: Many of the properties are the same as texture properties.
trans-unit.target: Many of the properties are the same as texture properties.

trans-unit.source: Sprite sheet properties
trans-unit.target: Sprite sheet properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Sheet Type
trans-unit.target: Sheet Type

trans-unit.source: Specify whether this sprite sheet is used for 2D sprites or UI elements. If you select Sprite sheet for UI, you can define sprite borders in the sprites.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether this sprite sheet is used for 2D sprites or UI elements. If you select Sprite sheet for UI, you can define sprite borders in the sprites.

trans-unit.source: Color Key Color
trans-unit.target: Color Key Color

trans-unit.source: The color used for transparency at runtime. This is only applied if Color Key Enabled is selected below
trans-unit.target: The color used for transparency at runtime. This is only applied if Color Key Enabled is selected below

trans-unit.source: Color Key Enabled
trans-unit.target: Color Key Enabled

trans-unit.source: Use the color set in the Color Key Color property for transparency at runtime. If this isn't selected, the project uses transparent areas of the sprite sheet instead
trans-unit.target: Use the color set in the Color Key Color property for transparency at runtime. If this isn't selected, the project uses transparent areas of the sprite sheet instead

trans-unit.source: Compress
trans-unit.target: Compress

trans-unit.source: Compress the texture to a format based on the target platform. The final texture size will be a multiple of 4.
trans-unit.target: Compress the texture to a format based on the target platform. The final texture size will be a multiple of 4.

trans-unit.source: ColorSpace
trans-unit.target: ColorSpace

trans-unit.source: The color space for the sprites in the sprite sheet (Auto, Linear, or Gamma)
trans-unit.target: The color space for the sprites in the sprite sheet (Auto, Linear, or Gamma)

trans-unit.source: Alpha
trans-unit.target: Alpha

trans-unit.source: The texture alpha format which all the sprites in the sprite sheet are converted to (None, Mask, Explicit, Interpolated, or Auto)
trans-unit.target: The texture alpha format which all the sprites in the sprite sheet are converted to (None, Mask, Explicit, Interpolated, or Auto)

trans-unit.source: Generate Mipmaps
trans-unit.target: Generate Mipmaps

trans-unit.source: Generates mipmaps for all sprites in the sprite sheet
trans-unit.target: Generates mipmaps for all sprites in the sprite sheet

trans-unit.source: Premultiply Alpha
trans-unit.target: Premultiply Alpha

trans-unit.source: Premultiply all color components of the images by their alpha component
trans-unit.target: Premultiply all color components of the images by their alpha component

trans-unit.source: Allow Multipacking
trans-unit.target: Allow Multipacking

trans-unit.source: Generate multiple atlas textures if the sprites can't fit into a single atlas
trans-unit.target: Generate multiple atlas textures if the sprites can't fit into a single atlas

trans-unit.source: Allow rotations
trans-unit.target: Allow rotations

trans-unit.source: Rotate sprites inside the sprite sheet to optimize space. This doesn't affect how sprites are displayed at runtime.
trans-unit.target: Rotate sprites inside the sprite sheet to optimize space. This doesn't affect how sprites are displayed at runtime.

trans-unit.source: Border size
trans-unit.target: Border size

trans-unit.source: The size in pixels of the border around the sprites. This prevents side effects in the sprite sheet.
trans-unit.target: The size in pixels of the border around the sprites. This prevents side effects in the sprite sheet.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
